com.foreach.across.modules.dynamicforms.domain.document.data

Class DynamicDocumentData

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.foreach.across.modules.dynamicforms.domain.document.data.DynamicDocumentData
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DynamicDocumentFieldAccessorResolver

    public class DynamicDocumentData
extends Object
implements DynamicDocumentFieldAccessorResolver
    Represent the document data for a specific document definition. Allows reading and setting the data in a strongly typed fashion, any value set will be checked against the excepted type.

    This does not apply the actual validation of the document, only acceptable value conversion (expected type and allowed in the list of values).

    Supports calculated fields if setCalculatedFieldsEnabled(boolean) is set to true. By default calculated fields are disabled and only the actively stored value will be returned.

    You usually do not want to work with DynamicDocumentData directly but through a DynamicDocumentWorkspace.

    Since:
    0.0.1
    Author:
    Arne Vandamme

    • Method Detail

      • setConversionService

        public void setConversionService(org.springframework.core.convert.ConversionService conversionService)
        Set the ConversionService that should be used by the DynamicDocumentDataAccessor.
        Parameters:
        conversionService - used in the data accessors

      • setEvaluationContext

        public void setEvaluationContext(org.springframework.expression.EvaluationContext evaluationContext)
        Set a custom EvaluationContext that should be used for the calculated fields. Usually a default context will have been set when creating the document data or the DynamicDocumentWorkspace.

        If no evaluation context is set, field calculations will not be supported at all.

        Parameters:
        evaluationContext - to use for calculated fields

      • setDocumentService

        public void setDocumentService(DynamicDocumentService documentService)
        Set the DynamicDocumentService that can be used for retrieving nested dynamic document fields. If none is set, nested document fields will not be supported (eg. for calculations).
        Parameters:
        documentService - to use

      • getValue

        public <T> T getValue(String fieldPath)
        Retrieve the value for a property path. There is no way to distinguish between the presence of the field and an empty field (null value). In both cases this will return null.
        Type Parameters:
        T - expected type of the value
        Parameters:
        fieldPath - path to the field
        Returns:
        value or null if field not present (or having actual null value)
        See Also:
        findValue(String)

      • findValue

        public <T> Optional<T> findValue(String fieldPath)
        Alternative for getValue(String) which returns a nullable Optional holding the field value. If null is returned, it means the field was not at all present in the document. Else the Optional will hold the field value, which might be null.
        Type Parameters:
        T - expected type of the value
        Parameters:
        fieldPath - path to the field
        Returns:
        null if field not present, else a field value holder

      • getDefaultValue

        public <T> T getDefaultValue(@NonNull
                             @NonNull String fieldPath)
        Retrieve the template value for a property path. This is the same as the newly initialized value of the field, but without actually performing the field initialization. The actual field value will be ignored and not modified when requesting the template value.
        Type Parameters:
        T - expected type of the value
        Parameters:
        fieldPath - path to the field
        Returns:
        value or null if field does not exist (or has an actual null value)

      • setValue

        public Object setValue(String fieldPath,
                       Object value)
        Set the value for a particular property path. This requires a matching DynamicDocumentFieldDefinition to be present for that property path, and the value to be of the target type expected by the field definition.

        This might also set intermediate property values if necessary.

        Exceptions will be thrown in case there is no such field or the value is of an unacceptable type.

        Parameters:
        fieldPath - to the field whose value should be set
        value - that should be set

      • getFieldType

        public Optional<org.springframework.core.convert.TypeDescriptor> getFieldType(String fieldPath)
        Get the TypeDescriptor for a given field. Will be empty if no field defined for that path.
        Parameters:
        fieldPath - to the field
        Returns:
        type descriptor

      • getFieldAccessor

        public DynamicDocumentFieldAccessor getFieldAccessor(String fieldPath)
        Get a field accessor for a particular property path. This requires a matching DynamicDocumentFieldDefinition to be present for that property path.
        Parameters:
        fieldPath - to the field
        Returns:
        field accessor

      • findFieldAccessor

        public Optional<DynamicDocumentFieldAccessor> findFieldAccessor(String fieldPath)
        Find a field accessor for the given property path. Will return empty if accessor can't be found because no such field is registered in the definition.
        Specified by:
        findFieldAccessor in interface DynamicDocumentFieldAccessorResolver
        Parameters:
        fieldPath - path to the field
        Returns:
        optional containing the accessor, never null

      • load

        public void load(@NonNull
                 @NonNull Map<String,Object> data)
        Load the given data into the document. Can be a map with fully qualified property keys, or with nested lists and maps.
        Parameters:
        data - to load in this document

      • deleteValue

        public Object deleteValue(String fieldPath)
        Delete a field from the document. Nothing will be done if that field (or its definition) does not exist.
        Parameters:
        fieldPath - path to the field that should be deleted

      • resetValue

        public void resetValue(String fieldPath)
        Reset a field value back to its default. An exception will be thrown if there is no field definition for that path.
        Parameters:
        fieldPath - path to the field that should be reset

      • asFlatMap

        public DynamicDocumentDataAsMapAdapter asFlatMap()
        Build a new Map accessor for this document data, as if all fields of the document have been flattened. Any operations performed on the map will result in type checking being applied.

        The adapter returned can be customized for databinding.

        Returns:
        map

      • setCalculatedFieldsEnabled

        public void setCalculatedFieldsEnabled(boolean enabled)
        When enabled, calculated fields will always be re-calculated when fetched. If disabled, the last calculated value will be returned instead and you must update them manually using updateCalculatedFields().
        Parameters:
        enabled - true if calculated fields should be enabled

      • isCalculatedFieldsEnabled

        public boolean isCalculatedFieldsEnabled()
        Returns:
        true if calculated fields are enabled

      • updateCalculatedFields

        public void updateCalculatedFields()
        Recalculates all calculated fields in this document and updates the cached value. You usually want to do this before saving a document as this might add missing calculated fields. Note that only live calculation of field values (isCalculatedFieldsEnabled() is true) will be guaranteed to produce the correct result for inter-dependent calculated fields.

      • initializeFields

        public void initializeFields()
        Initialize all fields in this document. Initialization will only occur if the field has no value set and if it has an initializer expressoin.

        @Generated(value="lombok")
public DynamicDocumentDefinition getDocumentDefinition()
        The document definition this data is for.

public Map<String,Object> getContent()
